snippet: Sweeping legislation signed by Gov. Rick Snyder on Tuesday will vastly reduce the power of organized labor in a state that was a symbol of union clout for decades.
abstract: Republican-dominated Michigan Legislature approves sweeping statewide changes to way unions will be financed, substantially reducing their power in state that has long been symbol of union might and an incubator for the American labor movement; Gov Rick Snyder signs legislation; Democrats and labor leaders vow retribution at ballot box and beyond.

byline.contributor: Steven Greenhouse contributed reporting from New York, Mary M. Chapman from Lansing and Steven Yaccino from Chicago.

lead_paragraph: Sweeping legislation signed by Gov. Rick Snyder on Tuesday will vastly reduce the power of organized labor in a state that was a symbol of union clout for decades.

headline.seo: Michigan Governor Signs Laws Limiting Unions
headline.main: Limits on Unions Pass in Michigan, Once a Mainstay
headline.print_headline: Limits on Unions Pass in Michigan, Once a Mainstay
